FuncDef: The display l2tp lac abnormal-rui-users command displays information about users that have abnormal online status on a device enabled with L2TP dual-system hot backup.
Examples: The upstream and downstream of following LAC users are all without increasing.
LTID: local assigned tunnel ID , RTID: Remote assigned tunnel ID
LSID: local assigned session ID , RSID: Remote assigned session ID
RG: Register(L:local,R:remote), FWS: Forwarding state(L:local interface,P:protect path)
LSID    RSID    LTID   RTID  UserID  UserName   RG state    MAC
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The display l2tp lac abnormal-rui-users command is used only on the master device to display information about L2TP LAC-side users that have traffic statistics unchanged when sending traffic. The information helps locate user devices that have abnormal online status.
Follow-up Procedure
If the specified L2TP tunnel or session is not needed, run the reset l2tp tunnel { lac | lns slot } { tunnel-item | tunnel-name } [ session ] command to tear down the specified L2TP tunnel or session.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
